term.name: immoralism
term.source: From Latin immoralis: opposed to accepted customs or morality.
term.def: An idea or intellectual stance (similar to &nihilism; or &skepticism;) that rejects conventional morality, systematic approaches to ethics, or even ethics as such. Friedrich Nietzsche (1844-1900) is the most prominent thinker who sometimes claimed to be an immoralist (although what he advocated was closer to &amoralism;).
